qas.question: Werner Heisenberg suggested that atoms are not what?
Werner Heisenberg believes that atoms are defined as what?
Who do not believe a switch from materialism to physicalism is necessary?
Who said "This extrapolation, however, is impossible... atoms are lots of things"
Scientists believed that the concept of matter did not change when what physics started?

context: With the advent of <b4_0>quantum physics<b4_0/>, some scientists believed the concept of matter had merely changed, while others believed the conventional position could no longer be maintained. For instance <b3_0>Werner Heisenberg<b3_0/> said "The ontology of materialism rested upon the illusion that the kind of existence, the direct 'actuality' of the world around us, can be extrapolated into the atomic range. This extrapolation, however, is impossible... atoms are not <a0_0><b1_0>things<b1_0/><a0_0/>." Likewise, some <b2_0>philosophers<b2_0/>[which?] feel that these dichotomies necessitate a switch from materialism to physicalism. Others use the terms "materialism" and "physicalism" interchangeably.
